intro: Crotalaria vitellina var. minor, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves, which are typically trifoliate. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It grows as an annual herb and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine in various parts of the world.
